unnormalised: The way we handle our hard-earned rupees has changed a lot, hasn't it? Remember the days when all transactions happened with physical cash? Now, banking and cash transactions are like a mixed masala – a bit of old, a bit of new, and a whole lot of convenience!
normalised: The way we handle our hard earned rupees has changed a lot, hasn't it? Remember the days when all transactions happened with physical cash? Now, banking and cash transactions are like a mixed masala, a bit of old, a bit of new, and a whole lot of convenience!

unnormalised: One big change is the rise of UPI. Nowadays, you see everyone from your local chai wala accepting payments through apps like PhonePe and Paytm. My vegetable vendor in Andheri accepts payments via QR code, and a recent transaction of ₹ 25 was super smooth. It’s so much easier than fumbling for change, isn't it? Plus, you get cashback offers sometimes!
normalised: One big change is the rise of U-P-I. Nowadays, you see everyone from your local chai wala accepting payments through apps like PhonePe and Paytm. My vegetable vendor in Andheri accepts payments via Q-R code, and a recent transaction of rupee twenty five was super smooth. It's so much easier than fumbling for change, isn't it? Plus, you get cashback offers sometimes!

unnormalised: Of course, old-school banking is still around. Folks in my family, especially the older generation, still prefer withdrawing cash from the ATM. For example, my grandmother withdrew Rs. 5000 on 10/10/2023 for Diwali shopping. They feel more secure with physical money, and it’s what they're used to. No harm in that, right?

For example, my grandmother withdrew rupees five thousand on tenth October two thousand and twenty three for Diwali shopping. They feel more secure with physical money, and it's what they're used to. No harm in that, right?

unnormalised: But even banks are evolving. Online banking and mobile apps are super popular, especially among young people. You can transfer money, pay bills, and even invest in stocks, all from your phone. The other day, I transferred Rs 10000 from my SBI account to my friend's ICICI account using the SBI Yono app, and it was done in a jiffy! It's a total game changer.

The other day, I transferred rupees ten thousand from my S-B-I account to my friend's I-C-I-C-I account using the S-B-I Yono app, and it was done in a jiffy! It's a total game changer.

unnormalised: However, we have to be careful too. Cyber fraud is a real concern. I heard a story about someone losing ₹ 20,000 after clicking on a suspicious link. So, always double-check before making any online transactions and be aware of UPI scams.
normalised: However, we have to be careful too. Cyber fraud is a real concern. I heard a story about someone losing rupee twenty thousand after clicking on a suspicious link. So, always double check before making any online transactions and be aware of U-P-I scams.

unnormalised: Ultimately, it's all about finding a balance that works for you. Whether you prefer the tangibility of cash or the convenience of digital payments, it is great to have options. And who knows what new innovations we will see in banking and cash transactions in the coming years? Exciting times ahead!
